meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of burning.
meanings.sent1: The combustibilities of the dry leaves made them perfect for starting a campfire.
meanings.sent2: Firefighters must be aware of the combustibilities of different materials to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the combustibilities of the students' excitement could set off a fire alarm.
meanings.sent4: The combustibilities of the situation were like a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.
meanings.sent5: The combustibilities of the fireworks lit up the night sky in a dazzling display.

meanings.definition: The ability to catch fire and burn.
meanings.sent1: The old barn was a danger due to its high combustibilities.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters quickly assessed the combustibilities of the building before entering.
meanings.sent3: The combustibilities of the spicy chili made it seem like a fiery dragon in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The combustibilities of the dry forest turned it into a blazing inferno within minutes.
meanings.sent5: The combustibilities of the oil spill caused a massive environmental disaster.
